definition: incantation/magic spell/curse/malediction/to revile/to put a curse on sb

sentences.english: A great way to break up the classic black party dress is to add shine.
sentences.chinese: 打破老派黑色派對裝魔咒的一大法寶就是增加閃光點。

sentences.english: Like I told you all,kissing a princess breaks the spell.
sentences.chinese: 就像我說的那樣，吻一位公主將打破魔咒。

sentences.english: Allegri wants to break taboo against Lecce.
sentences.chinese: 阿萊格里希望打破對萊切的魔咒。

sentences.english: There is another example in accord with the curse.
sentences.chinese: 最近又有個例子印證了這一魔咒。

sentences.english: I've done this for many years and it works like a charm, " said the director.
sentences.chinese: 這就像個魔咒一樣，我這麼些年屢試不爽。

sentences.english: I was cursed while using it to cut down monsters.
sentences.chinese: 我用這把劍砍殺妖魔的時候中了魔咒。

sentences.english: The "illness" in question is the bewitchment of intelligence by language.
sentences.chinese: 問題之中的“疾病”就是通過語言所產生的智力魔咒。

sentences.english: He broke a three-match losing streak in Rome last week and is hoping for better.
sentences.chinese: 上週在羅馬他擊破了三連敗魔咒，希望未來會更好。

sentences.english: A city spell-bound under the aging sun.
sentences.chinese: 蒼老的日頭下整座城都被魔咒封鎖。

sentences.english: Could there please be a book of Hogwart spells?
sentences.chinese: 將會有一本關於霍格沃滋魔咒的書嗎？

sentences.english: The team that finally broke the Celtics' curse.
sentences.chinese: 那賽季的湖人終於打破凱子的魔咒。

sentences.english: I called it the curse of abundance.
sentences.chinese: 我把它成爲豐裕的魔咒。

sentences.english: Want to perform an exorcism, let's do it right.
sentences.chinese: 你想試驅魔咒，那就讓我們正確地試一試吧。

sentences.english: Now the spell he had nurtured would become an old man's malediction.
sentences.chinese: 現在他培養出的魔咒變成了一個老人的毒咒。

sentences.english: Harry used the threat of magic spells to get rid of the sniffy Dudley Dursley.
sentences.chinese: 哈利假裝要使用魔咒，叫不識趣的達力滾蛋。

definition: cannot bear or stand/be unequal to/very/extremely
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
end/conclusion/to come to an end/to terminate (sth)
whether or not/can it or can't it/is it possible?
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to have no opportunity/no way (of doing sth)/no chance/no connection/not placed (in a competition)/(in pop lyrics) no chance of love, no place to be together etc
(of a spirit or deity) to possess sb
